etymology.interpretation: Not a regular pictophonetic or ideogrammic formation; scribes merged features of multiple similar-looking graphs into a single standardized form. Its attested sense relates to troubled breathing, aligning its usage with notions of breath or obstruction rather than a clear semantic-phonetic decomposition.

examples.chinese: 奔跑过后(奔跑過後)，他丂得厉害(他丂得厲害)。
examples.pinyin: Bēnpǎo guòhòu, tā kǎo de lìhai.
examples.english: After running, he was panting badly.

examples.chinese: 山路陡峭(山路陡峭)，走几步就觉得丂(走幾步就覺得丂)。
examples.pinyin: Shānlù dǒuqiào, zǒu jǐ bù jiù juéde kǎo.
examples.english: The mountain path is steep; after a few steps one feels out of breath.

examples.chinese: 医生问他是否有丂和胸闷的症状(醫生問他是否有丂和胸悶的症狀)。
examples.pinyin: Yīshēng wèn tā shìfǒu yǒu kǎo hé xiōngmèn de zhèngzhuàng.
examples.english: The doctor asked whether he had symptoms of panting and chest tightness.
